ai-ud1.6:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-ud1.6:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Mahākassapa was staying in the Pipphali cave.
ai-ud1.6:1.4_0: Then after some time Venerable Mahākassapa got up from that affliction.
ai-ud1.6:2.1_0: Now at that time five hundred deities were ready and eager for the chance to offer alms to Mahākassapa.
ai-ud1.6:2.2_0: But Mahākasspa refused those deities. In the morning, he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Rājagaha for alms.
ai-ud1.6:2.3_0: (going) to the poor streets, to the wretched streets, to the weaver’s streets.
ai-ud1.6:2.4_0: The Buddha saw him wandering for alms in the streets of the poor, the destitute, and the weavers.
ai-ud1.6:3.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud1.6:4.3_0: with defilements ended and flaws purged:
ai-ud1.6:4.4_0: that’s who I call a brahmin.”
ai-ud1.6:4.5_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
